title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR HIV PREVENTION, CARE AND TREATMENT

description.narrative: By 2020, key actors have the capacity required to plan, coordinate, monitor and evaluate integrated HIV/AIDS interventions based on evidence, gender equality and equity, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age children, particularly girls and those in vulnerable regions, have access to quality basic education, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, key actors have the capacity required to plan, coordinate, monitor and evaluate integrated HIV/AIDS interventions basedon evidence, gender equality and equity

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical guidance and financial support to develop normative documents aligned to the most recent WHO recommendations for the HIV/AIDS response in general, and PMTCT, pediatric and adolescent HIV care and treatment in particular, to mobilise resources for the HIV/AIDS response as well for the fight against COVID-19, and to ensure continuing HIV care and treatment services. Support also includes annual reviews of HIV/AIDS response at the national, regional and district levels, strategic and evidence-based and equity informed planning processes, as well as monitoring for decision-making. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
